body_html: @zdevito I am thinking we should do this, but gated using a keyword argument to the export method. And in fact, there are three modes you may think of doing this: one mode is completely overriding all symbolic definitions, and using ATen ops exclusively; another mode is only using ATen ops where we would have been unable to export otherwise; and finally a "conformant" mode, where we only export non-experimental ONNX ops.
body_text: @zdevito I am thinking we should do this, but gated using a keyword argument to the export method. And in fact, there are three modes you may think of doing this: one mode is completely overriding all symbolic definitions, and using ATen ops exclusively; another mode is only using ATen ops where we would have been unable to export otherwise; and finally a "conformant" mode, where we only export non-experimental ONNX ops.
body: @zdevito I am thinking we should do this, but gated using a keyword argument to the `export` method. And in fact, there are three modes you may think of doing this: one mode is completely overriding all symbolic definitions, and using ATen ops exclusively; another mode is only using ATen ops where we would have been unable to export otherwise; and finally a "conformant" mode, where we only export non-experimental ONNX ops.
